title: NBA player says he was trying to give money to homeless man before police struggle
text:
By Cox Media Group National Content Desk NEW YORK â€” 
Atlanta Hawks player Thabo Sefolosha testified Wednesday that he was trying to give money to a homeless man before police took the NBA player to the ground and arrested him. 
According to The Associated Press , the incident occurred April 8 when officers were responding to the stabbing of another NBA player outside a nightclub in New York City. Officers reportedly told Sefolosha, 31, and others to leave the area. Sefolosha said he and his friends were walking away from the scene when Officer JohnPaul Giacona started swearing at him. 
>> From MyAJC.com: Thabo Sefolosha testifies in his own defense 
"I said: 'If you saw me in a different place, you wouldn't say that. You're a midget,'" Sefolosha said of Giacona, who is 5-foot-7. 
Sefolosha said he briefly stopped to give money to a homeless man, Amos Canty. That's when police kicked Sefolosha, brought him to the ground and arrested him, Sefolosha said. Part of the incident was captured on cellphone video. 
>> Read more trending stories 
Sefolosha, who said injuries he received during the incident stopped him from playing, pleaded not guilty to charges of disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and obstructing government administration. 
Former teammate Pero Antic, Canty and others who were with them that night also testified Wednesday, with Canty calling the arrest "rough." 
Six officers have testified against Sefolosha. The trial continues Thursday.
